availableStrength.description: 1 mCi/mL Injection, solution form with intravenous route
.01 mCi/mL Injection, solution form with intravenous route
.025 mCi/mL Injection, solution form with intravenous route

clinicalPharmacology: Regulates the colloidal osmotic pressure of blood. It is used to increase the circulating plasma volume, thereby reducing hemoconcentrtion and blood viscosity. Also used as a transport protein that binds naturally occurring, therapeutic and toxic materials in circulation.
description: A diagnostic radiopharmaceutical containing iodinated I 131 albumin for intravenous imaging. Following intravenous injection, radioiodinated albumin human is uniformly distributed throughout the intravascular pool within 10 minutes; extravascular distribution takes place more slowly (2 days). Indicated for use in determinations of total blood and plasma volumes, cardiac output, cardiac and pulmonary blood volumes and circulation times
mechanismOfAction: Serum albumin acts as a high molecular weight, very soluble osmolyte
name: Serum albumin iodonated
